DESC.PARA: The set_areascal command sets the fractional area scale (areascal). In spectral analysis, the areascal is usually set to "1" and the ARF is used to scale the data.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
bkg_id - the id of the background, if setting the background value; default=None

DESC.PARA: Set the areascal of the default dataset to 0.75.
Set the areascal of dataset id=2 to 0.90.
Set the areascal for the first background of dataset id=1 to 0.75.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
